title: quarkus-cli failing to install

labels.name: area/jbang
labels.description: Issues related to when using jbang.dev with Quarkus

body:
### Describe the bug


Quarkus CLI depends on internet explorer -- which is not available on windows.

- Please make it installable via winget : https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/package-manager/winget/



```log
PS> iex "& { $(iwr https://ps.jbang.dev) } trust add https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/quarkus/quarkus-cli/"
iwr : The response content cannot be parsed because the Internet Explorer engine is not available, or Internet
Explorer's first-launch configuration is not complete. Specify the UseBasicParsing parameter and try again.
At line:1 char:12
+ iex "& { $(iwr https://ps.jbang.dev) } trust add https://repo1.maven. ...
+            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotImplemented: (:) [Invoke-WebRequest], NotSupportedException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : WebCmdletIEDomNotSupportedException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.InvokeWebRequestComman
   d
```

```
winget install quarkus-cli
No package found matching input criteria.
```

### Expected behavior

_No response_

_No response_
